page.title: 14Waterhouses Middle School
page.content: Waterhouses Middle School educates children aged 9-13 years from Grindon, Waterhouses, Calton, Ipstones, Cauldon, Cauldon Lowe and Waterfall. Originally a Secondary School opened in 1957 designed by Wendy Harries it was built of local stone. Near the entrance is a fish pond with a bronze figure of a watersprite by the sculptor, Willi Soukop, who also carved the door handles in the form of local animals, a fox, hare and leveret, the first art works to be used in building a County school. The school became Middle in 1979. It has a large playground, tennis courts and large playing fields, a Science Laboratory and rooms equipped for Home Economics, Craft/Design and Technology and Art/Craft, plus four general classrooms, a large hall/gym. with changing rooms, a heated indoor swimming pool, garden and greenhouse.
